page.title: 01TIDWORTH
page.content: Tidworth is situated in undulating countryside on Salisbury Plain midway between Andover and Amesbury on the A338. The Hampshire/Wiltshire border runs through the centre of the village from East to West. There has been a village here since 1086 with evidence of even earlier occupation possibly going back to the Bronze Age; with remains of Tumuli, Earthworks and Hill Forts in the area. The Ministry of Defence bought North and South Tidworth and part of Shipton Bellinger in 1894,a total of 6616 acres. Tidworth today is a Military Garrison with the barracks and training areas dominating. Of the 12000 population, 10000 are military personnel and their families. There is a central shopping area with houses to the North and South and Barracks to the South West.
